Package algorithms.bipartite

Class MinHeapForRT2012

java.lang.Object
algorithms.bipartite.MinHeapForRT2012
public class MinHeapForRT2012 extends Object
A min heap for the MinCostUnbalancedAssignment. It uses the "YFastTrie min priority queue algorithm" pattern by default if the VM has enough memory, else uses a Fibonacci Heap. All operations for the "YFastTrie" are constant time. 
     prefer to use YFastTrie as all operations are essentially
     O(log_2 log_2(w)) where w is the largest integer to store in trie.
     in contrast Min-Heap/PriorityQueue and Fibonacci have these trade-offs
                                 FibHeap             MinHeap/PQ
      extractMin()        O(log_2(n))                  O(1)
      insert()                   O(1)                  O(log_2(n))
      decreaseKey()       O(log_2(n))                  O(log_2(n))
The YFastTrie has O(log log(M)) operations including successor and predecessor where M is the maximum value in the domain.
Author:
nichole

  • Constructor Details

    • MinHeapForRT2012

      public MinHeapForRT2012(int maxValue, int approxN, int maxNumberOfBits)
      Parameters:
      maxValue - estimate of maximum value to store.
      approxN - approximate number of nodes expected to be in the heap as a rough maximum at a given time. (it's used to help determine which algorithm to use internally). IA min heap for the MinCostUnbalancedAssignment. It uses the "YFastTrie min priority queue algorithm" pattern by default if the VM has enough memory, else uses a Fibonacci Heap. All operations for the "YFastTrie" are constant time. The Fibonacci Heap has O(1) operations excepting extractMin which is O(lg_2(N_nodes)).
      maxNumberOfBits -

  • Method Details

    • printLastKnownMinMax

      void printLastKnownMinMax()

    • insert

      public void insert(HeapNode node)
      for fib. heap runtime is runtime is O(1). for yft runtime complexity for best case is O(1) when there is already a similar key in the YFastTrie, else is O(log_2(w)) + O(w-l) where w is the number of bits set in the constructor and l is the prefix tree already filled leading up to the value node. The performance of the YFastTrie increases when more nodes are in it (can see that in the l term).
      Parameters:
      node -

    • extractMin

      public HeapNode extractMin()
      if using a YFastTrie the runtime complexity is O(log log(M)) where M is the number of bits of the maximum value the trie was initialized with. If using a FibonacciHeap, the runtime complexity is O(log_2 N) or better where N is the number of entries in the heap.
      Returns:
      extracted node which is the minimum in the queue

    • decreaseKey

      public void decreaseKey(HeapNode node, long key2)
      if using a YFastTrie the runtime complexity is O(log log(M)) where M is the number of bits of the maximum value the trie was initialized with. If using a FibonacciHeap, the runtime complexity is O(1) if the node and the new key reside in same heap in the group of heaps, else the remove and insert makes the runtime complexity O(log_2(n)).
      Parameters:
      node -
      key2 -

    • remove

      public void remove(HeapNode node)
      remove the node from the min-priority queue. If using a FibonacciHeap, the runtime complexity is O(log_2(n)). If using YFT, runtime complexity is O(log_2(w)) where w is the bitlength of the maximum value storable in the trie set at construction time.
      Parameters:
      node -
